Deficiency Narrative: The operation is attempting to use chemicals on their own to control pests rather than using a licensed professional.
Correction Narrative: The administrator sent supporting documentation via-email of pest control receipt.

Deficiency Narrative: While conducting a walk through of the operation there were ants found in the closet of one of the child.
Correction Narrative: The administrator sent supporting documentation via-email of pest control receipt.

Deficiency Narrative: A serious incident did not provide the location and telephone number of the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation came into compliance by emailing the updated SIR with the date, the operation location and contact number, and how the incident was resolved.

Deficiency Narrative: A serious incident documented that hospitalizing a child was how the incident was resolved.
Correction Narrative: The operation came into compliance by emailing the updated SIR with the date, the operation location and contact number, and how the incident was resolved.

Deficiency Narrative: The date of a serious incident was not recorded.
Correction Narrative: The operation came into compliance by emailing the updated SIR with the date, the operation location and contact number, and how the incident was resolved.

Deficiency Narrative: On Pg. 97 of the policies and procedures, the plan does not define what a conflict of interest would be as it relates to children who are placed at your operation or their families.
Correction Narrative: Policy was updated to meet the requirement of this rule.

Deficiency Narrative: When reviewing the emergency evacuation/relocation diagram the diagram doesn't show a designated location in operation take shelter from threatening weather.
On pg. 230 the policies and procedure speak to verification of skin test. It does not identify which vaccinations are required if any.
Correction Narrative: The policies and procedures were updated to meet the rule requirement.

Deficiency Narrative: on page 99 of the policies and procedures the admissions criteria states that children can be placed if they have a outdated or a psychological completed within 6 months of placement. The rule for treatment services children is specific for ED. The policy is in conflict with standard number 748.1219 (1)(A)(i).
Correction Narrative: During the inspection the Administrator demonstrated an understanding of appropriate admissions criteria and the policies and procedures were updated to adhere to the rule.
